intro: Lobelia irasuensis subsp. irasuensis, commonly known as the irasu lobelia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
